string.name: instructionsText1
string.br: Blue recycling bins can be found across residential estates in Singapore. Paper, plastic, glass and metal recycleables can be deposited into these blue bins for collection.
Items contaminated by food or liquid waste cannot be recycled. The following infographic shows items that are commonly mistaken for recycleables.

string.name: ewasteText1
string.br: E-waste is made of unwanted electrical and electronic equipment. Examples include computers, TVs, batteries, and light bulbs. E-waste is mainly made of metal and plastic, but may contain some heavy metal and other materials of concern. Hence, we should minimise e-waste and dispose of them properly. Households can reduce e-waste through repairing devices where possible, donating items that can still be used, or by recycling e-waste through recycling schemes as follows:

resources.string: For more information, visit NEA Singapore

string.name: recyclingLocationsText1
string.br: In addition to the blue recycling bins found across residential areas, there are 50 smart Reverse Vending Machines (RVMs) in shopping malls and schools all over Singapore. Help save the environment while gaining rewards for recycling!

string.name: recyclingLocationsText2
string.br: When you recycle aluminium cans or plastic bottles, you can win grocery vouchers, shopping mall vouchers, sports vouchers, attraction vouchers, and more! Refer to the following infographics to see what you can earn through recycling:

resources.string: Further information can be found at RecycleNSave.sg and NEA Singapore
